      • getMethod

        public static Method getMethod(Class clazz,
                               String name,
                               Class... args)
                        throws SecurityException,
                               NoSuchMethodException
        Find the named method in the given class that accepts the given arguments. This goes beyond the normal Class.getMethod(String, Class...) call in that it builds argument list permutations based on the super classes and interfaces of each of the arguments given here. This is so that we can find a method that accepts the arguments given here when the arguments here are subclasses/interfaces of the those declared in the method signature. For example, if B is a subclass of A, but a method that takes an A is defined, the normal getMethod() will not return the method when passing in B.
        Parameters:
        clazz -
        name -
        args -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodException
        SecurityException

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(Class<T> clazz)
                         throws NoSuchMethodException,
                                IllegalArgumentException,
                                IllegalAccessException,
                                InvocationTargetException
        Try and create an instance of the given class. We try the following ways to create the instance:
        • zero-arg constructor,
        • static getInstance() method.
        • static instance() method
        Parameters:
        clazz -
        Returns:
        an instance of the given class, never null.
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodException
        InvocationTargetException
        IllegalAccessException
        IllegalArgumentException
